resources.string: The numeric field allows only numbers on it. The previous edittext was intentionally configured to accept any kind of input so that you can test the validation.
The alpha field will check if the field contains only standard letters.
This field will check for valid person name OR surname
This field will check for valid person name AND surname
The email field will only accept valid email input.\nNote that this will only perform a regular expression check
The credit card field will only accept valid credit card numbers. The validation is performed through the Luhn Algorithm
The phone number will be validated using regexps It will allow several formats.\n\t- +00 01 23456799\n\t- 0123456789
The domainname check will be performed using regexps.
The ip address check will be performed using regexps.
The check will be performed using regexps only.
the nocheck test will always pass the test ( useful only if you want to check that the field is not empty)
This is a regular phone check ( like the previous one ).\nThe only difference is that here we\'ve a custom message for the empty case and the invalid case. Try it out!
This fields validates a phone when the user enters something. If the user doesn\'t enter any data the EditText will validate!
This field only validates with 2 or more "a"

The field validates only if the field content matches the regexp given in the xml. The current regexp is: /^[a]{2,}$/\nNote that the regexp is case sensitive so that the field won\'t validate if you enter "AA"
The current check is performed by a programmatically added validator. Check out the source code.
The previous field will validate only if it is not empty and one of the following is true:\n- it is a valid email address.\n- it is a valid credit card
The entered phone number is invalid
Full name is invalid (must be at least 2 space separated names)
